Workshop Material: Optimization with JuMP in Julia

Following along

  • If you have never used Julia before, you can access the slides and code here.
  • If you know how to use Julia, the IJulia notebook that is used for this workshop is available in the GitHub repository: https://github.com/sebmart/optimization_jump_julia.

Running the notebook/slides

All the material used for this workshop is available on GitHub.

  • The presentation and standalone code are merged into a notebook (Jupyter) available here.
  • The notebook can be viewed on the web, or opened with Julia using the IJulia package to be able to run the code and use its interactive features.
  • The slides are contained in the notebook: they can be accessed using RISE. They can be also be viewed without Julia here, with the interactive features disabled.

To go further and learn Julia

The notebook contains a large appendix that can be used as an introduction to coding in Julia and to using IJulia notebooks.

To get started:

  • Install Julia (you can start here).
  • Follow Appendix 1 of the notebook (see slides) for further instructions.
